Container.Name: Enshrouded
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Palworld and run it.
**Server Name:** Enshrouded Docker **Password:** Docker
**Configuration:** The configuration is located at: ./enshrouded_server.json.
**ATTENTION:** First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!
Variable will overwrite setting in config file
DO NOT EDIT IP IN CONFIG FILE
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.
You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!

Config.Name: SERVERPASS
Config.Description: Server password. If empty, will keep value already present in config file

Config.Name: Server Name
Config.Description: Server name. If blank, will use what is already present in config file.

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container download at startup. If you want to install a static or beta version of the game change the value to: '2278520 -beta YOURBRANCH' (without quotes, replace YOURBRANCH with the branch or version you want to install).

Config.Name: UDP - Gameport
Config.Description: UDP Gameport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to click an 'Show more settings ...' and change the port number)

Config.Name: UDP - Queryport
Config.Description: UDP Queryport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to click an 'Show more settings ...' and change the port number)

Config.Name: UDP - Queryport (config file)
Config.Description: This set the query port in the server config file. Must match the port used in UDP - Queryport. If empty, will use what is already present in the config file.

Config.Name: UDP - Gameport (config file)
Config.Description: This set the gameport in the server config file. Must match the port used in UDP - Gameport. If empty, will use what is already present in config file.

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
